generated.title: GeneratedTotalAngularMomentum
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'TotalAngularMomentum'

description*.en: "Total Angular Momentum" combines both the spin and orbital angular momentum of all particles and fields. In atomic and nuclear physics, orbital angular momentum is usually denoted by $l$ or $L$ instead of $\Lambda$. The magnitude of $J$ is quantized so that $J^2 = \hbar^2 j(j + 1)$, where $j$ is the total angular momentum quantum number.

title: TotalAngularMomentum
description: "Total Angular Momentum" combines both the spin and orbital angular momentum of all particles and fields. In atomic and nuclear physics, orbital angular momentum is usually denoted by $l$ or $L$ instead of $\Lambda$. The magnitude of $J$ is quantized so that $J^2 = \hbar^2 j(j + 1)$, where $j$ is the total angular momentum quantum number.
